structure.unit: STATE AND FEDERAL HIGHWAYS -- LIMITED ACCESS FACILITIES -- TURNPIKES -- ROAD BONDS -- BILLBOARDS -- RECYCLERS

law.catch_line: Cost of construction to be borne by state -- State may accept donations.
law.text: The cost of construction of the primary roads shall be borne entirely by the state, or by the state and federal government, where the roads are built in cooperation, and they shall be maintained entirely by the state, but any county, municipality or person may make donations to the state in aid of the construction or maintenance of any road. The state may accept any donation on the terms and conditions prescribed by the department.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4356t-5.
